WindowSetInterval.summary: The setInterval() method of the interface repeatedly calls a function or executes a code snippet, with a fixed time delay between each call.

remarks.para: This method returns an interval ID which uniquely identifies the interval, so you can remove it later by calling .

-Polyfill of setInterval which allows passing arguments to the callback in core-js

WindowSetInterval.returns:
The returned intervalID is a numeric, non-zero value which identifies the timer created by the call to setInterval(); this value can be passed to to cancel the interval.It may be helpful to be aware that setInterval() and share the same pool of IDs, and that clearInterval() and can technically be used interchangeably.
For clarity, however, you should try to always match them to avoid confusion when maintaining your code.The delay argument is converted to a signed 32-bit integer.
This effectively limits delay to 2147483647 ms, roughly 24.8 days, since it's specified as a signed integer in the IDL.
